summary: Sydney is the state capital of New South Wales and the most populous city in Australia. It is on Australia's south-east coast, on the Tasman Sea. Inhabitants of Sydney are called Sydneysiders, comprising a cosmopolitan and international population. The site of the first British colony in Australia, Sydney was established in 1788 at Sydney Cove by Arthur Phillip, commodore of the First Fleet, as a penal colony.
funfact: Canberra was born from the war between Sydney and Melbourne over capital city!

top-5.name: Opera House
top-5.description: One of the symbol of Australia, known all over the world, like the Eiffel Tower!
top-5.facts: Created in 1973 and designed by Danish architect JÃ¸rn Utzon. Described as an "artistic monument", it is one of the most recognisable landmarks in both Sydney and Australia and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

top-5.name: Bondi to Coogee Beach walk
top-5.description: A great walk along the shore of 2h is waiting for you.
top-5.facts: Superb views, glorious beaches, amazing swimming pools... but also sharks.

top-5.name: The Blue Mountains
top-5.description: The Blue Mountains are part of a national park, located within 2h drive west of Sydney.
top-5.facts: Did you know? Their names come from the colour of the rocks: they are blue!

top-5.name: Manly Beach
top-5.description: One of the most famous beach for surfers in the world!
top-5.facts: Access it via a ferry from the Sydney CBD (approx. 30 min). Some surfing schools are here, so... it is time to give it a try!

top-5.name: Taronga Zoo
top-5.description: Situated at the top of a hill, you'll have a great point of view on Sydney.
top-5.facts: You'll discover girafs, dolphins, koalas, kangaroos, ... but also some very dangerous predators.
